post_text: We are currently experiencing internet issues with the live stream of tonight’s Board of Education meeting. We are working on remedying the problem. The meeting will still be recorded and posted to our YouTube Channel. We are also monitoring any public comments submitted through the form linked below and on our website. Thank you for your patience in this matter.
shared_text:
Green Island UFSD - Heatly School
August 5 at 3:26 PM ·

UPDATE: Gov. Cuomo extended the Open Meetings Law suspension. The meeting will not be open to in-person attendance. Individuals can stream the meeting on YouTube and submit questions via a Google Form: https://bit.ly/31qQhbJ

The Green Island Board of Education will hold its regular meeting tomorrow, Thursday, Aug. 6. An audit committee meeting begins at 5:30 p.m. with the regular meeting to follow at 6 p.m. Individuals can stream the meeting here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LN9L9w1mVAw

If Gov. Cuomo does not extend the Open Meetings Law suspension, individuals could attend the meeting in person. If they plan to attend, they will need to be physically distanced, wear a mask and complete a self health assessment when arriving at the school. Individuals would watch the stream in the gym. If the Open Meetings Law suspension is extended, the meeting would not be open to public attendance, but could be streamed on YouTube.
